FuncDef:
The tcp window command sets the size of the sending/receiving buffer of the connection-oriented socket.
The undo tcp window command restores the default size of the buffer. The tcp window command sets the size of the sending/receiving buffer of the connection-oriented socket. The undo tcp window command restores the default size of the buffer. By default, the size of the packet sending/receiving buffer of the connection-oriented socket is 8K bytes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the size of the packet sending/receiving buffer of the connection-oriented Socket.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32, in KBytes.

ExtraInfo: Running the tcp window command changes the TCP window size that is used for setting up a TCP session.
